values.title: sandia hand meshes are not installed as valid gazebo model resources

content.raw: currently, meshes are installed under `share/sandia-hand-version/ros/sandia_hand_description/meshes/`, which is a valid ros package (`share/sandia-hand-version/ros/sandia_hand_description/manifest.xml`), but the mesh resources are not available to gazebo
content.html: currently, meshes are installed under share/sandia-hand-version/ros/sandia_hand_description/meshes/, which is a valid ros package (share/sandia-hand-version/ros/sandia_hand_description/manifest.xml), but the mesh resources are not available to gazebo

values.title: no collision body for most of hand

content.raw: While trying to grab a ladder rung, I found that the hand was sometimes passing through the rung.  Looks like there's no collision body defined for the big box part of the hand.
content.html: While trying to grab a ladder rung, I found that the hand was sometimes passing through the rung. Looks like there's no collision body defined for the big box part of the hand.

values.title: Damping extremely large?

content.raw:
The damping on the finger joints is set to 30 (Nm/rad/s ?) while the maximum effort is set to 11 Nm. This limits the maximum velocity of the joints to about 0.3 rad/s and the closing time for the fingers (towards an angle of 45 degrees) is between 2 and 3 seconds. 

How does this damping parameter compare to the real Sandia hands? Are these values valid? For the driving taks we would like to quickly change hand positions on the steering wheel.
content.html:
The damping on the finger joints is set to 30 (Nm/rad/s ?) while the maximum effort is set to 11 Nm. This limits the maximum velocity of the joints to about 0.3 rad/s and the closing time for the fingers (towards an angle of 45 degrees) is between 2 and 3 seconds.

How does this damping parameter compare to the real Sandia hands? Are these values valid? For the driving taks we would like to quickly change hand positions on the steering wheel.

values.title: Add noise to cameras

content.raw: The Sandia hand cameras should have noise added, using the same parameters that are [used in the Multiesense-SL](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/default/ros/multisense_sl_description/urdf/multisense_sl.urdf?at=default) (search for "gaussian").
content.html: The Sandia hand cameras should have noise added, using the same parameters that are used in the Multiesense-SL (search for "gaussian").

values.title: add noise to hand IMUs

content.raw:
The Sandia hand IMUs should have noise added, using the same parameters that are [used in the Multiesense-SL](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/default/ros/multisense_sl_description/urdf/multisense_sl.urdf?at=default) (search for "gaussian").

5.1.13 is already out; this'll need to go into 5.1.14.
content.html:
The Sandia hand IMUs should have noise added, using the same parameters that are used in the Multiesense-SL (search for "gaussian").

5.1.13 is already out; this'll need to go into 5.1.14.

values.title: Latest Sandia Hand from default branch breaks drcsim

content.raw:
When trying to compile default drcsim using latest sandia-hand, the compilation seems to broken with the next message:

```
[ 72%] Generating irobot_hand_description.urdf
Linking CXX shared library libDRCVehiclePlugin.so
[ 72%] Built target DRCVehiclePlugin
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/xacro/xacro.py", line 35, in <module>
    xacro.main()
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/xacro/src/xacro.py", line 563, in main
    eval_self_contained(doc)
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/xacro/src/xacro.py", line 504, in eval_self_contained
    eval_all(doc.documentElement, macros, symbols)
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/xacro/src/xacro.py", line 456, in eval_all
    str(node.tagName))
xacro.XacroException: Some parameters were not set for macro xacro:sandia_hand
```

I saw this error in today's [nightly build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-debbuild/214/consoleFull) and was able to reproduce it locally. Using latest stable sandia-hand_5.1.13-1 works just fine.

P.D: I will update jenkins to launch drcsim after sandia-hand default changes to be able to catch this kind of errors as soon as possible.
content.html:
When trying to compile default drcsim using latest sandia-hand, the compilation seems to broken with the next message:

[ 72%] Generating irobot_hand_description.urdf
Linking CXX shared library libDRCVehiclePlugin.so
[ 72%] Built target DRCVehiclePlugin
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/xacro/xacro.py", line 35, in <module>
    xacro.main()
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/xacro/src/xacro.py", line 563, in main
    eval_self_contained(doc)
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/xacro/src/xacro.py", line 504, in eval_self_contained
    eval_all(doc.documentElement, macros, symbols)
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/xacro/src/xacro.py", line 456, in eval_all
    str(node.tagName))
xacro.XacroException: Some parameters were not set for macro xacro:sandia_hand

I saw this error in today's nightly build and was able to reproduce it locally. Using latest stable sandia-hand_5.1.13-1 works just fine.

P.D: I will update jenkins to launch drcsim after sandia-hand default changes to be able to catch this kind of errors as soon as possible.

values.title: Apparent left/right mismatch in collision geometries

content.raw: There's a [report](http://www.theroboticschallenge.org/forum/default.aspx?t=299) of a mismatch in the left and right collision geometries in the hands.  @hsu points to the use of [reflection in the URDF](#!/osrf/sandia-hand/src/1858777998fbd0e007cba6c54a7866454d761410/ros/sandia_hand_description/urdf/sandia_hand_simple_shapes.urdf.xacro?at=default#cl-275).
content.html: There's a report of a mismatch in the left and right collision geometries in the hands. @hsu points to the use of reflection in the URDF.

values.title: simple_grasp.py in sandia_hand_teleop isn't installed

content.raw: In the sandia_hand_5.1 branch, the simple_grasp.py program is installed so that it can be used by drcsim. Something has changed in default, though so that it isn't installed. The `/usr/share/sandia-hand-5.1/ros/sandia_hand_teleop` folder only has a manifest.xml, when it used to have more files.
content.html: In the sandia_hand_5.1 branch, the simple_grasp.py program is installed so that it can be used by drcsim. Something has changed in default, though so that it isn't installed. The /usr/share/sandia-hand-5.1/ros/sandia_hand_teleop folder only has a manifest.xml, when it used to have more files.

values.title: Allow IP address of interface to be changed

content.raw:
According to BDI , the Sandia hands require a fixed IP address for your interface software.

Is it possible to change this so that which ever IP address initiates contact with hands (which are assumed to have a known IP address) is in control.

This impacts our flexibility in configuring software across multiple computers for the DRC.
content.html:
According to BDI , the Sandia hands require a fixed IP address for your interface software.

Is it possible to change this so that which ever IP address initiates contact with hands (which are assumed to have a known IP address) is in control.

This impacts our flexibility in configuring software across multiple computers for the DRC.

values.title: setHomeSrv is not working when used multiple times in the same session

content.raw: I currently work on auto-homing the fingers and i am using the rosservice set_finger_home to set hall_pos to zero.In my test program, i just set a joint position to 0.3 then call set_finger_home and repeat these 2 steps several times.The first time i call this service is ok(finger remains stop while hall_pos set to zero),but when i call the service second time, hall_pos remains zero but the finger moves to the previous position, then i call the service again, the finger move back to the original position when i turned on the hand. So i can't perform the 2 steps for more than 1 time. Is it the problem of the driver?
content.html: I currently work on auto-homing the fingers and i am using the rosservice set_finger_home to set hall_pos to zero.In my test program, i just set a joint position to 0.3 then call set_finger_home and repeat these 2 steps several times.The first time i call this service is ok(finger remains stop while hall_pos set to zero),but when i call the service second time, hall_pos remains zero but the finger moves to the previous position, then i call the service again, the finger move back to the original position when i turned on the hand. So i can't perform the 2 steps for more than 1 time. Is it the problem of the driver?

values.title: Setting CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH variable with multiple directories breaks build

content.raw:
[Line 7 in CMakeLists.txt](#!/osrf/sandia-hand/src/e582518fbfe292f0a2bd23f9550c271c58cb0137/CMakeLists.txt?at=default#cl-7) should not be there. It breaks the build if you have multiple directories in your CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH environment variable. 
~~~
set (CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH "/usr;$ENV{CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH}")
~~~

Right now, say I have my CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH environment variable set to `/home/jhoare/foo:/opt/ros/groovy`  then the set line will take that whole variable as one path, and it does not get properly parsed out if that line was not there. This will prevent the build from succeeding, as it doesn't recognize `/opt/ros/groovy` as one of the paths to search. 

If your goal is to support building to /usr, you should have the build script set that environment variable before calling CMake.
content.html:
Line 7 in CMakeLists.txt should not be there. It breaks the build if you have multiple directories in your CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH environment variable. 

set (CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH "/usr;$ENV{CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH}")

Right now, say I have my CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH environment variable set to /home/jhoare/foo:/opt/ros/groovy then the set line will take that whole variable as one path, and it does not get properly parsed out if that line was not there. This will prevent the build from succeeding, as it doesn't recognize /opt/ros/groovy as one of the paths to search.

If your goal is to support building to /usr, you should have the build script set that environment variable before calling CMake.

values.title: Path to installed headers in sandia_hand_driver are not correct

content.raw:
If I try to include the header files from the sandia_hand_driver package, I will get compiler errors since the headers include themselves, but with an incorrect path. 

Many of them #include<sandia_hand/filename.h> 

but they should actually be #include<sandia_hand_driver/sandia_hand/filename.h> 

It actually looks to me that they should probably not be installed to the "sandia_hand" subfolder of "sandia_hand_driver" and then the includes would look like #include<sandia_hand_driver/filename.h>"
content.html:
If I try to include the header files from the sandia_hand_driver package, I will get compiler errors since the headers include themselves, but with an incorrect path.

Many of them #include<sandia_hand/filename.h>

but they should actually be #include<sandia_hand_driver/sandia_hand/filename.h>

It actually looks to me that they should probably not be installed to the "sandia_hand" subfolder of "sandia_hand_driver" and then the includes would look like #include<sandia_hand_driver/filename.h>"

values.title: what do fmcb_temp and mobo_temp mean?

content.raw:
What do fmcb_temp of finger/raw_state and mobo_temp of mobo/raw_state mean?

```
mobo_temp: [2797, 2784, 994]
```

```
fmcb_temp: [50374, 24, 1139]
```

I'd like to know the meaning of these three values and units.

Are these temperature useful information to avoid over-heat of the motor or the drivers?
content.html:
What do fmcb_temp of finger/raw_state and mobo_temp of mobo/raw_state mean?

mobo_temp: [2797, 2784, 994]

fmcb_temp: [50374, 24, 1139]

I'd like to know the meaning of these three values and units.

Are these temperature useful information to avoid over-heat of the motor or the drivers?

values.title: Not getting images with rviz Camera display for calibrated camera

content.raw: We calibrated the Sandia hand using the standard ROS tools and run stereo_image_proc with it. We can successfully produce pointcloud data and rectified images, but the rviz Camera Display does not appear to work. Looking at things, it seems a frame_id is set for the Sandia hand camera_info, but the frame_id for the images is left empty. I suspect this is the reason for the Camera Display problems. Any reasons why the frame_id for images is left empty?
content.html: We calibrated the Sandia hand using the standard ROS tools and run stereo_image_proc with it. We can successfully produce pointcloud data and rectified images, but the rviz Camera Display does not appear to work. Looking at things, it seems a frame_id is set for the Sandia hand camera_info, but the frame_id for the images is left empty. I suspect this is the reason for the Camera Display problems. Any reasons why the frame_id for images is left empty?

values.title: Specifying camera calibration parameters

content.html:
sandia_hand_node.cpp reads camera calibration parameter from the fixed paths.

#!/osrf/sandia-hand/src/16563eb69006cf93011dfefc1aa6777e94a1b966/ros/sandia_hand_driver/nodes/sandia_hand_node.cpp?at=default#cl-525

It means that we cannot specify other calibration parameters and it is forced to use the same calibration parameters if we use two sandia hands.

values.title: Specifying frame_id of images

content.raw:
sandia_hand_node.cpp publishes camera_infos with fixed frame_id.

#!/osrf/sandia-hand/src/16563eb69006cf93011dfefc1aa6777e94a1b966/ros/sandia_hand_driver/nodes/sandia_hand_node.cpp?at=default#cl-433

And also the node publishes images with empty frame_id.

It should be able to be specified by something like ros param.
content.html:
sandia_hand_node.cpp publishes camera_infos with fixed frame_id.

#!/osrf/sandia-hand/src/16563eb69006cf93011dfefc1aa6777e94a1b966/ros/sandia_hand_driver/nodes/sandia_hand_node.cpp?at=default#cl-433

And also the node publishes images with empty frame_id.

It should be able to be specified by something like ros param.

values.title: hard coded file paths in ASL demo

content.raw:
Tried running the ASL demo and found there were some hard coded file paths in the python code.
```
#!python

cmd = "cd /home/mquigley/sandia-hand-ws/src/sandia-hand/ros/sandia_hand_teleop/simple_grasp && bash -c \". /home/mquigley/sandia-hand-ws/devel/setup.bash && ./simple_grasp_asl.py only \\\"%s\\\" 4 1\"" % self.text
```
I've attached an updated version that uses the file's location as a reference when finding the other resources for the command. Probably not the best way to do it, but I don't know python and this seemed like the quickest fix.

Otherwise this is a pretty cool demo.
content.html:
Tried running the ASL demo and found there were some hard coded file paths in the python code.

cmd = "cd /home/mquigley/sandia-hand-ws/src/sandia-hand/ros/sandia_hand_teleop/simple_grasp && bash -c \". /home/mquigley/sandia-hand-ws/devel/setup.bash && ./simple_grasp_asl.py only \\\"%s\\\" 4 1\"" % self.text

I've attached an updated version that uses the file's location as a reference when finding the other resources for the command. Probably not the best way to do it, but I don't know python and this seemed like the quickest fix.

Otherwise this is a pretty cool demo.

values.title: Sandia-hand crash when compiling from source

content.raw:
Hi, 

I'm trying to install DRCSIM from this [tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=drcsim_install&cat=drcsim). I'm running Ubuntu 16.04 and using ROS Kinetic, so I had to compile it from source. 

When I launch 
```
#!bash

catkin_make install
```
the compilation crashes and these are the two errors I get

```
#!bash

recipe for target 'sandia-hand/ros/sandia_hand_driver/gui/homing/moc_homing_dialog.cxx' failed
recipe for target 'sandia-hand/ros/sandia_hand_driver/CMakeFiles/sandia_hand_homing.dir/all' failed
```
Google has not been really helpful on this matter, so I hope you'll point me in the right direction to get it done. Thank you in advance ! 

Guillaume
content.html:
Hi,

I'm trying to install DRCSIM from this tutorial. I'm running Ubuntu 16.04 and using ROS Kinetic, so I had to compile it from source.

When I launch 

catkin_make install

the compilation crashes and these are the two errors I get

recipe for target 'sandia-hand/ros/sandia_hand_driver/gui/homing/moc_homing_dialog.cxx' failed
recipe for target 'sandia-hand/ros/sandia_hand_driver/CMakeFiles/sandia_hand_homing.dir/all' failed

Google has not been really helpful on this matter, so I hope you'll point me in the right direction to get it done. Thank you in advance !

Guillaume
